subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] quikscript.org
msgSnippet: Oh wow, this is great. I ve been hoping someone would do something like this for a while. I prefer to decouple fonts and keyboard layouts. Do you have any
messageBody:
Oh wow, this is great. I've been hoping someone would do something like this for a while.
 
I prefer to decouple fonts and keyboard layouts. Do you have any plans to add a Private Use Area-using font that (mostly) conforms to the other ones, as described in http://www.frogorbits.com/qs/csur.html? ame.eot and ame.woff on http://www.frogorbits.com/Fonts/ should be all you'd need.
 
Incidentally, if you're looking for an easy tag name, I'd suggest [pua] — the important thing about the text is that it's in the Private Use Area, not that it's in a particular font.
 
(as far as I know only Abbots Morton Experiment uses U+E66E and U+E66F for angled parentheses, but that's the only thing that I snuck in myself)
 
 
On Fri, May 9, 2014, at 05:14 PM, 'Jayson Pifer' jayson@... [Read_Alphabet] wrote:
 

Testing is never complete so I’m open to suggestions for improvements, bug fixes, additions, etc.  Sadly, my skills in reading and writing software still surpasses my ability to read and write in quikscript, but I hope the forum will remedy this deficiency.

 

I hope others can give it a try and chat in quikscript.

 

Jayson
